article.title: Solution of Hartree-Fock-Bogoliubov equations and fitting procedure using N2LO Skyrme pseudo-potential in spherical symmetry

multiple_choice_question.text: Which density exhibits the highest peak value within the nucleus (around r=0) according to Figure 1?
According to Figure 2, which coefficient, related to the central field, shows a significant difference between SN2LO1 and SLy5 interactions for both protons and neutrons?
Based on Figure 5, what is the approximate energy cutoff on the Wood-Saxon basis needed to achieve an accuracy of 1 keV when comparing WHISKY and LENTEUR results for 208Pb?

According to Formula (58), which of the four solutions for β represents the physically acceptable behavior of the radial wave function at the origin, considering the requirement of a non-zero nuclear density at the center?
